intro: Senecio mason-halei, commonly known as the Mason-Hale's groundsel, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a low, spreading shrub with hairy, gray-green leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, often arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Senecio mason-halei is adapted to harsh, dry environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
